channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Apple AI Pin Wearable In The Works, Says Report
item.description: An Apple AI pin for iPhone owners could let you talk to an Apple chatbot as early as 2027 according to a recent report. It features multiple microphon...

item.title: Audeze Unveils Its Flagship LCD-5s Planar Headphones With SLAM Technology At NAMM
item.description: The LCD-5s planar magnetic headphones use Symmetric Linear Acoustic Modulator or SLAM acoustic technology for a powerful bass and accurate midrange tu...

item.title: Trio of dairy giants recall infant formula over contamination fears
item.description: Nestle, Danone and Lactalis recalled infant formula in several countries over the possible contamination of cereulide, which can cause nausea and vomi...

item.title: Ray Dalio says CEOs mourning the rules-based order must accept that change is here for good
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Google’s Android Update—Bad News For Millions Of Pixel Users
item.description: Pixel users given an update surprise this month — and it's causing a backlash.

item.title: Ken Griffin says America was sent an ‘explicit warning’ from the bond market and it’s time to get the national debt in order
item.description: "I think there's an explicit warning that if your fiscal house is not in order, the bond vigilantes can come out and retract their price," Ken Griffin...

item.title: Google's Universal Commerce Protocol Signals The End Of Search-Based Shopping
item.description: Google's Universal Commerce Protocol isn't just an API, it's infrastructure for AI-native shopping. Learn why major retailers are backing it over Amaz...

item.title: Microsoft Starts Sharing Your Location With Your Employer
item.description: Controversial update is just weeks away — and you can't opt out. Here's what to know.

item.title: The Trump TACO trade is driving up the price of gold as central banks hoard bullion to hedge against the dollar
item.description: Gold has overtaken the euro and U.S. Treasuries as the preferred source of reserves for central banks, the team at LPL Financial reported.

item.title: Elon Musk predicts ‘agonizingly slow’ Cybercab and Optimus rollout. But he’s not giving up on Tesla’s big bet on robots
item.description: Tesla’s production rate will “eventually end up being insanely fast,” Musk said.

item.title: Exclusive: Cubby raises $63 million in Goldman Sachs-led funding to scale self-storage software
item.description: Cubby just raised a $63 million Series A, led by Growth Equity at Goldman Sachs Alternatives, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.description: GameStop is expected to close doors of around 30 New York locations as part of massive nationwide shutdown affecting 470 stores by the month's end.

item.title: Big Tech stocks haven’t been this cheap in months. Is it time to buy?

item.description: Washington state GOP Chair Jim Walsh opposes the proposed millionaire tax, saying "nobody wants it" and warns that it could lead to broader income tax...

item.title: Airlines have 580 million reasons to like GLP-1 weight-loss drugs, analysis finds
item.description: U.S. airline companies stand to save hundreds of millions each year from Americans losing weight thanks to GLP-1 drugs, according to a new study.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
